Legal & Regulatory Compliance: Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, ByteDance policies, and the Code of Conduct.
Do not conduct business with sanctioned countries, entities, or individuals in violation of trade-control laws.
Do not participate in or facilitate money-laundering or terrorism-financing activities.
Do not trade in securities, or encourage others to trade, on the basis of material non-public information obtained through your work.
Whistle-blower Protection & Non-Retaliat: Do not retaliate against anyone who, in good faith, reports a concern or takes part in an investigation.
Information Protection & Privacy: Do not disclose confidential, proprietary, or personal information to unauthorized persons or in public settings.
Record Integrity & Fraud Prevention: Maintain complete and accurate records; never falsify or misrepresent company data or documents.
Never provide false, misleading, or incomplete information to ByteDance, its partners, regulators, or other stakeholders.
Do not engage in any form of fraud or deception intended for unlawful gain or to cause loss to others.
Anti-Corruption & Conflicts of Interest: Do not offer, promise, give, solicit, or accept bribes or anything of value to improperly influence business decisions.

Do not engage in bullying, coercive, threatening, abusive, or exploitative behavior toward anyone in the workplace.
Substance Use & Impairment: Do not perform work or enter company premises while impaired by alcohol or drugs.
Do not possess, sell, distribute, or consume illegal drugs or controlled substances on company premises or while conducting company business.
Protection of Company Assets: Do not intentionally damage, misuse, or steal company physical or intellectual assets, or use them for unlawful purposes.
Occupational Health & Safety: Provide and maintain a workplace that meets or exceeds all applicable health and safety laws and recognized standards.
Deliver regular, adequate health and safety training to all workers.
Establish and follow procedures to prevent, manage, track, and report occupational injuries and illnesses.
Develop, communicate, and rehearse effective emergency preparedness and response plans.
Labor & Human Rights: Do not employ child labor or individuals below the minimum legal working age.
Do not assign hazardous or night work to anyone under 18 years of age.
